title: How To Leave a Private Story on Snapchat

steps.title: Open Snapchat .
steps.content: Open Snapchat . The app icon looks like a white ghost on a yellow background that you'll find on one of your Home screens, in the app drawer, or by searching. The Snapchat camera will open when you open the app. If you aren't logged into Snapchat, you'll first need to tap LOG IN and enter your email address and password before proceeding.

steps.title: Tap the Stories tab.
steps.content: Tap the Stories tab. It's the icon of two people at the bottom of your screen, to the right of the default camera tab. A list of stories will then display along the top of your screen. You can also swipe left to open this tab. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the story you want to leave.
steps.content: Tap the story you want to leave. The story will have a padlock icon next to its name if it's set as private.

steps.title: Tap and hold your finger on the story until a menu pops up.
steps.content: Tap and hold your finger on the story until a menu pops up. Once you see the pop-up, you can stop pressing the screen. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Leave Story.
steps.content: Tap Leave Story . It's usually the first option in the menu.

steps.title: Tap Leave.
steps.content: Tap Leave . You'll need to confirm your action before you can actually leave the story. The owner of the private story will not be notified that you have left.
